availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John B. Veach (Franklin County, Kentucky, cabinetmaker and soldier.)

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, cabinetmaker and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of William Veach and Nancy Veach. Attended school in Franklin County, Kentucky, in 1850. Cabinetmaker in Franklin County in 1860. Served in the 22nd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private and sergeant from December 2, 1862, to December 24, 1864. Served in the 7th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a sergeant from December 24, 1864, to July 18, 1865.
